title: What happened to lowering systemic damage in 9.3/9.4?
body:
Is that no longer happening ? Seems there hasn’t been a word about it in weeks now, 
just like in mid season 8 when they said they were looking into addressing damage in pre season then completely forgot about it..

replies.body: Please Rito we need more durability
I'd rather less damage than more durability, to be honest.
i second this
They just said that because the boards/reddit were blowing up about how high “damage” is, so they tell people they’re gonna do something so everyone shuts up. Classic rito
Riot balance team and doing their job properly are two concepts that never meet.

9.2 did a good job though.

And 9.3, while not addresing anything systematic, it got Irelia out of mid for good and nerfed plenty of problem Champs. 

Overall DMG is still to high but if they continue we could end on a pretty enjoyable game.

Yes the 9.2 changes are definitely a step in the right direction, but they proposed further changes to “systemic damage“ outside of those 9.2 changes, which is what i’m talking about. There was even a whole post with their plans and talking about what’s causing “time to kill” being significantly lower, but then they just went quite and haven’t said anything else for weeks. 

Imo the 9.2 while are definitely good, but damage is still way out of line..

if you cut damage in half how are any assassins at all going to do their intended job? 

Take {{champion:107}} or {{champion:91}} for example. I know Rengar is hated around here but these 2 are balanced by doing a lot of damage really quickly then dying after or at least not being able to kill another target, having to escape. They do this very well. If they both lost half their damage they wouldn't be able to kill a thing and don't even get me started on how obscene tanks would be in a situation like that.

that's not an assassin then,

even then, you still had to hit EVERYTHING to do that 60%

I'm sorry but my Udyr used to kill anyone within 1-2 seconds just from hitting a Tiger Strike. Ravenous Hydra +Triforce erased anyone. It took me about 7 seconds to kill an Ezreal with a Nami. Morgana used to actually dominate and pull off full team kills.

really?  the average endgame AP used to be 1000 , 1400 if you were veigar, 1200 if you cut boots entirely...

previously: watch Annie push a button and her target is dead. That's what DFG did

you know what item values used to be?  {{item:3157}} :  100 ap ,  {{item:3027}}  100+ when finished ,  {{item:3003}}  80+ based on mana amounts , {{item:3174}} :  now 30, used to 60+

what has changed however:  armor and magic penetration,  tons of free bonus damage  (seriously, {{item:3145}}  does minimum 50 extra damage... it did 0 before and only had 12% spellvamp ),  AMBIENT GOLD GENERATION HAS SKYROCKETED , BOUNTIES HAVE SKYROCKETED, 

season 5 was fine, season 6 introduced the "add bonus damage" trend and it was questionable but still playable, but it made it where even minor interactions were very threatening.  This is the season that professionals started passively farming and avoiding lane interaction, which in return caused riot to increase "visible" or "watchable" damage, which caused the professionals to play even more passively

I'm not sure why you mention Udyr, yes you do a lot of damage with trinity force, but how likely were you to have that trinity force during the early game?  You would get kited and kept away easily by almost every support at the time.  You would be a beast if you ever reached your target, but then, so was every fighter/bruiser/juggernaut

Bounties haven't skyrocketed. If anything, that's the problem: Team contribution no longer gives takedown assist gold unless the takedown has 3+ consecutive kills.

In other words, the game used to give a 1 kill full gold to the killer, and a partial cut divided to the rest of the team. Gold was spread out more.

Now..... if teams are trading kills, only the person securing the kills gets the gold.

And, the cut takedown allies get has also gone down. If you kill someone worth 1000g, the ally cut is something like 275, divied up to 4 ways. If someone was on a 1 kill takedown in the old system, the main killer got 450, and the rest of the team got something like 600 split up.

The old system snowballed TEAMS. The new system snowballs individuals.
But therein lies a crux: The current meta also punishes teams who do not get fed with their snowballed individual. It's up to the individual to abuse the lead they get. Otherwise, their underfed team might create opportunities if the other team also has a fed player.

The old system allowed you to defend a base better, simply because everyone had items.

P.S. Look at this account's Morgana Performance. So far I'm 100% on her. Over a 10 local KDA. Can you guess my real rank?

I can tell you how long I've played; Since March 2013

P.P.S. A smart Udyr didn't rush Trinity. He rushed {{item:3172}} and then started working a Trinity. And it was easier to snowball Udyr then. His clear and sustain was faster, and he didn't have to deal with as many wall jumpers. P.S. You also first item bought {{item:3009}} , so the Zephyr would amplify it. No movement speed issues whatsoever. You also started Tiger/Bear, not Tiger/Phoenix, which current meta farmers do. By the end of your first clear or two and 2-3 kills, you had level 3 E.

Also, the key to 1 shotting Tiger strike was {{item:3230}} , not Trinity.
I have never duplicated what I did with Udyr then. I had legit 36/0/9 games with the end scores being 44/51/32. That's how lopsided I was.

how much damage did RH do?  Trinity does 120 - 300 for every proc every 1.5 seconds and I think that's always been its cooldown

I remember RH used to be good because of its lifesteal and high AD, but not much else about it

It aoe life stealed. Also, it's an auto attack reset when used correctly. On Udyr you could get off 3 attacks in a split second by autoing with Tiger, then clicking to activate the active, and by the time it was over your auto was up again.

I'm not saying the build didn't have a Trinity, btw, but the Life steal was more godly than tank. I personally hate tank Udyr.

P.S. The key to Hydra was that Tiger had a 432% AD scaling on the bleed. Trinity has 20 AD. Hydra 80. 4 times to bonus.

P.S. Varus used to build Randiun's. So did Ashe. Troll? What? It was a dueling advantage, since 90% of the kit's damage is in the first 2-3 items.
